title: Certified Refurbished Echo Plus (2nd Gen) - Premium sound with built-in smart home hub - Sandstone
features: A Certified Refurbished Echo Plus is refurbished, tested, and certified to look and work like new.
Echo Plus has a built-in Zigbee hub to easily setup and control your compatible smart home devices, and an improved sound for streaming music.

New premium speakers powered by Dolby play 360¬∞ audio with crisp vocals and dynamic bass response. You can also use your voice to adjust equalizer settings or pair with a second Echo Plus (2nd gen) for stereo sound.
Ask Alexa to play music, answer questions, read the news, check the weather, set alarms, control compatible smart home devices, call almost anyone, and more.
Set up your smart home without a separate hub. Ask Alexa to control compatible smart lights, switches, sensors, door locks, and more. Echo Plus also includes a built-in temperature sensor.
Ask Alexa for a song, artist, or genre from Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, SiriusXM, and more. With multi-room music, play music on compatible Echo devices in different rooms.
Call or message almost anyone hands-free. Instantly drop in on other rooms in your home or make an announcement to every room with a compatible Echo device.
With seven microphones, beamforming technology, and noise cancellation, Echo Plus hears you from any direction‚Äîeven while music is playing.

reviews.reviewTitle: The entire Echo system has changed for the worst...
reviews.reviewText:
I changed my review from 5 stars to 1 star because of a software update that now forces me to specify which light, power strip, and/or other devices I want to turn on/off. All of my rooms, lights, power strips, etc... are in various groups for a reason. Each light, outlet, and other devices have a unique name (IE: The upstairs hallway lights are named UH-Light, UH-Light2, and UH-Light 3, my smart power strip has unique ports like TV, Monitors, etc..).

YESTERDAY (9/18/2019) I was able to walk into a room and say "Alexa, turn the light on" (in my home office for example) and it turns the light on, Today (9/19/2019) I'm sitting in my home office and I say "Alexa turn the light off" and I get the response "There are multiple devices that share that name, which one do you want".

The master bedroom - Setup with only lights (MBR-light, or something like that so I can identify it later when adding other stuff), the wife used to say "Alexa, turn the light off" because that's what she has always said before going to sleep. Today she can't do that because of Amazon's development team.

So I say "Alexa turn the office light off" and it turns the ENTIRE OFFICE GROUP OFF. So now I have to go to the app to turn the light off.

I reached out to Amazon customer support who tells me I have to be specific when asking the echo to turn the light off as in "Alexa, turn the office light off/on" and that it has always been this way. When I tried to tell them that yesterday I was able to say "Turn the light off" they said it wasn't possible and I have always had to be specific.

I set up groups for a reason, that being I can go into a room, say "Alexa, turn the light on" without having to remember each light bulb name or what I named the room/group. Yes, I know what the group names are, I don't expect everyone in my house to remember the group names.

There was a software/firmware update overnight that broke all of my Echo's and Amazon's customer support will not acknowledge it.

I will not recommend this device to anyone else until they put it back to the way it was.

Update 9/20/2019 - Amazon Customer support says I have to be specific when telling it which light to turn on, but the Help section of the Alexa APP says:

"You can also add your Alexa-Enabled device to a smart home group and control without having to remember the group name. For example, to control the lights in the "Living room," you can say:

* "Alexa, Turn on the lights"
* "Alexa, set the lights to blue"
* "Alexa, dim the lights"

Update 10/23/2019 - Amazon still hasn't fixed the problem, I still cannot say "Alexa, turn the light off" like I was able to do since I set up my first echo. It's probably been 2 years now (maybe only one, I don't remember exactly). I still haven't heard from Amazon tech support, I haven't heard from Customer support, come to think of it, I only hear from Amazon when they don't deliver on time and I have to call them about something else. They were advertising it as a selling point on their echo devices. As long as you have an "echo" device in the room you are in and it's in a group with the same echo, you should be able to say turn the light off...

After watching some videos, I am more tempted to scrap all of my Echos and move to Google Home assistant because Amazon just isn't keeping up with the other stuff Google is doing.

Just like Apple, Amazon is more worried about putting out new products rather than fix their current products.

YOU'RE FAILING AMAZON! YOU'RE FAILING.
I didn‚Äôt get the bulb with the speaker, what do I need to do to get the bulb?

This was like new, the quality of the refurbished echo is really good and the packaging was well done. The product is like new and I have had no issues with it. Glad I was able to save a few bucks and still get a quality product. Thanks!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound quality and has been a fun addition to the family home.
reviews.reviewText:
I have been itching to get an Echo for quite a while. I was a little hesitate due to the worries of Skynet taking over some day in the future. At this point if it is going to happen it will have. So figured it was a great time to get into the good gracious of Amazon and Alexa.

I have a family of 6. We spend alot of dad's off days in the kitchen. So when shopping around I wanted an Alexa with Premium Sound quality as we all love music. My biggest question about this product was will the sound quality meet my expectation. I was worried due to some reviews.

Testing the sound quality I was more than impressed. The Echo/Amazon app allows you to adjust bass and some other sound options. Sound volume can fill a room quit easily.

There is still a lot I am learning about how much I can utilize Alexa. But she is used enough to where she is definitely an assistant to the family. She is like that robot from the Jetsons lol. Family music trivia, setting alarms and reminders, music and news, and wife loves the weather noises to help sleep "Alexa, turn on Thunder Storm sounds."

There is a learning curve. And a few months later I am still learning as I want to fully utilize the technology. So far I have added two Echo Dots. It is quite fun to her Echo avaiable when hands are full. For example, if I am home alone and getting dressed for work, why not say "Alexa, shuffle Tupac."

Too many glitches and bumped my other devices offline. Do not order unless you have wifi the speed of sound. I stream on my Fire TV, love my Echo 1st Gen and my Echo Dot 2nd Gen. The group fell out of love very quickly, so we're forgetting using the Echo Plus- it's not worth the running all over the house reconnecting everything and doing resets:-(
While I love my Echos I think they are a little overpriced. I got a refurbished product and works great. I thill think it needs some more work, on software and apps used with it.

I just bought this and had it set up for 3 days and I love it! I've never bought anything refurbished before but this sounds great! I wonder about the price because I see a $69 one too did i get the wrong one?

As soon as I turned it on the speaker was distorted and crackles. I started the return process within an hour of receiving it and immediately bought a brand new one that was not refurbished. Don't try to save a few bucks, 20$ is not worth it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Refurbished is the way to go!
reviews.reviewText: Can‚Äôt tell that it was refurbished. Works excellent. I will be adding more echos soon.

Pros: great sound quality, modern look, great voice rec.

Cons: commands are a little tricky, sometimes alarm/timer won‚Äôt shut off until i unplug it, slight delay in bluetooth audio

Oh I just love it so. The sound is rich and crisp. My little echo wasn't cutting it in terms of sound volume. I was tired of connecting speakers to my old device; and, decided to give this one a try after reading reviews. Boy am I glad I followed my instinct in trusting my fellow Amazonians. This speaker is GREAT. The volume generously covers the entire first floor of my home; and, can also be heard upstairs. Setup was painless using the Alexa app; and I'm now back to enjoying the full benefits of my Music Unlimited subscription. I bought a refurbished unit and it looks and performs like brand new. I almost ended up paying significantly more on a Bose and so glad I decided on this Echo Plus.

The sound is really good. It has base and loudness, two things I was looking for. Very similar to my Bose system. That being said, I wish it was freaking wireless! I'm assuming that will happen in the future. So, for now I am enjoying it in my kitchen and I suppose if I want to hear it in my backyard, I'll place it by the open window. Set up was a little jenky but I got it to work sooooo!

P. S. Best Buy has/had new Echo2 w/ smart bulb and plug for $109. 99.

After setting everything up, and using the Echo plus smart hub feature, I suddenly lost control of my devices. After much time wasted, I reconnected the devices (they still showed up in the Alexa app, even though that couldn't control them either), and they work again. But wasting all that time, and not being able to count on Amazon to make these things work consistently, is really annoying. My Google device in another house seem more reliable and user-friendly.

Seems to work well But not enough installation information for a beginner like me. What I thought might take a few days is turning into a few weeks. Amazon doesn't make it easy to get to the Echo Support Group. They apparently think everyone is smart enough to set things up like you had been doing it all of your life.
